questions.question_text: When configuring vSphere Replication for a virtual machine, what is the lowest Recovery Point Objective (RPO) that can be selected?
Which two Fibre Channel zoning options are supported with vSphere 6.x? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The badges provide a visual indicator of the alert status for the following alert types.

Health alerts that usually require immediate attention.

Risk alerts indicating that you should look into any problems in the near future

Efficiency alerts indicating that you can reclaim resources.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations-Manager/6.6/com.vmware.vcom.core.doc/GUID-53B4F038-AE75-46B9-BBDC-89D58301449E.html?hWord=N4IghgNiBcIKoGcCmAnABAZQMZIHZhQEsB7aNAUQDdIBXMAFyTXoAsmBBCVetAITAAmAcyQI0AM2LoA8gCMAVkiz0xk9GDSUASkkiEAXk2kAHVAxK4xAWTD4RMhUp4BxFMRrGQAXyA

choices.A: The Risk badge indicates potential future problems that may degrade the performance of the system.
choices.D: Risks require attention now to correct system performance problems.
choices.B: Risks may require attention in the near future.
choices.C: The Risk badge indicates problems that are degrading performance of the system.

questions.question_text: Which two are true about the Risk badge in vRealize Operations? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Modifying the C:\ProgramData\VMware\CIS\cfg\vmware-vpx\vpxd.cfg file and adjusting the <networkrollback> xml tag
choices.D: Modifying the C:\ProgramData\VMware\CIS\cfg\vmware-vpx\firstboot\vpxd-service- spec.prop file and adjusting the <rollback> xml tag
choices.B: Modifying the C:\ProgramData\VMware\CIS\cfg\vmware-vpx\vpxd.cfg file and adjusting the<rollback> xml tag
choices.A: Modifying the vpxd advanded configuration options and adding the config.vpxd.network.rollback key

questions.question_text: Which two allow for the disabling of Network Rollback operations? (Choose two.)

An administrator is configuring the Failover Order option on a vSphere Distributed Switch.
Which two options should be used with IP-hash load balancing? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
You must set all uplinks from the team in the Active failover list . The Standby and Unused lists must be empty.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.networking.doc/GUID-523FDFBD-EAEC-44A5-9451-F63EB792F156.html

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.networking.doc/GUID-73AB2E00-FE02-4D1B-970F-7D2F21F52825.html?hWord=N4IghgNiBcIGZgJYQPYDcCmAnABCrAJtngA4AuiKAdjgYgM5laIBGArmRgTvQO6JkAxgAsQAXyA

Point no. 7 - Specify how the uplinks in a team are used when a failover occurs by configuring the Failover Order list.
1) Active- Continue to use the uplink if the network adapter connectivity is up and active.
2) Standby-Use this uplink if one of the active physical adapter is down.
3) Unused-Do not use this uplink.
